DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine whether delayed umbilical cord clamping , compare early umbilical cord clamping , improve infant iron status 6 month age .
DOC.brief_title: Umbilical Cord Clamping Infant Iron Status
DOC.detailed_description: In develop country , 50 % child become anemic 12 month age . Risk factor iron deficiency ( ID ) include low birth weight , maternal prenatal ID , male sex . Iron deficiency anemia ( IDA ) infancy childhood particular concern potentially detrimental effect development , may irreversible even treatment correct deficiency . Delayed umbilical cord clamp intervention increase infant 's iron endowment birth show increase hemoglobin ( Hgb ) concentration two month age . We determine whether two-minute delay clamp umbilical cord normal-weight , full-term infant significantly affect infant iron hematological status 6 month age . In addition , determine whether effect delay cord clamp significantly enhance subgroup infant high risk develop iron deficiency .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman deliver study site hospital Delivery Cesarean section Pregnancy ≤ 36 ≥ 42 week gestation Multiple gestation Diagnosis follow current pregnancy : hemorrhage require clinic/hospital admission , placental abnormality , fetal anomaly , Down 's syndrome fetus Diagnosis preeclampsia eclampsia current previous pregnancy Diagnosis time mother follow : Diabetes , hypertension , cardiopathy , chronic renal disease Infant major congenital malformation Infant birth weight less 2500 g Mother planning breast fee least 6 month Mother smoke current pregnancy Unwilling return followup study visit hospital
